topic.title: Upgrading to HPE Helion OpenStack® 2.0 to 2.0.1

body.section: Performing the Upgrade from HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 to 2.0.1HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 shipped with example configuration files, and you were able to modify them to suit your needs.

section.note: The configuration you specified will remain unchanged through the upgrade process; however, if you made any configuration changes by passing parameters to any Ansible playbooks using the -e option, you should find the affected files and make the required changes directly in the files in helion/my_cloud and commit them to the git repository so that those changes are tracked and applied during the upgrade process. Otherwise they will not be applied.

body.section: You may also install HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0.1 as a full install. Those instructions are found in the installation guide.

To begin the upgrade process, log in to the lifecyce manager node as the user you created during the HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0 deployment, and mount the install media at /media/cdrom; for example: sudo mount hLinux-cattleprod-amd64-blaster-netinst-20151009-hlm.2015-11-13T07:32:19_caf1ffc.iso /media/cdrom Unpack the following tarball:tar faxv /media/cdrom/hos-2.0.1/hos-2.0.1.manifest-20151113T062512Z.tar Run the included initialization script to update the deployer: ~/hos-2.0.1/hos-init.bash Run the configuration processor: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml Run the ready deployment playbook: ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml Run the upgrade playbook: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-upgrade.yml
